DOC.brief_title: Efficacy Safety So-Cheong-Ryong-Tang Perennial Allergic Rhinitis
DOC.criteria: 1. age 1860 year 2. presence two nasal symptom ( rhinorrhea , nasal congestion , nasal itch sneeze ) severity score ≥ 2 ( 0 = symptom , 1 = mild symptom , 2 = moderate symptom , 3=severe symptom ) 3. presence nasal symptoms 2 consecutive year ; 4. positive reaction one perennial allergen skin prick test . 1. treatment nasal/oral corticosteroid within past month ; nasal cromolyn tricyclic antidepressant within past two week ; nasal/oral decongestant , nasal/oral antihistamine , antileukotrienes within past week 2. presence rhinosinusitis ( paranasal sinus Xray demonstrate mucosal thickening , partial complete opacification paranasal sinuses ) 3. presence hypertension ( systolic ≥ 180 mmHg diastolic ≥ 100 mmHg ) 4. presence abnormal liver function ( aspartate transaminase ( AST ) alanine transaminase ( ALT ) ≥ 100 IU/L ) abnormal renal function ( blood urea nitrogen ( BUN ) ≥ 30 mg/dL creatinine ≥ 1.8 mg/dL ( male ) , 1.5 mg/dL ( female ) ) 5. presence neoplasm , severe systemic inflammation , systemic disease affect rhinitis 6. history drug allergy 7. history anaphylaxis allergic test 8. pregnancy lactation 9. participation clinical study within past 3 month .
